intro: Sauropus gour-maitii, commonly known as the Malayan evergreen or the green mangrove, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in coastal areas and mangrove swamps. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short peduncles. The plant is adapted to saline environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils.
